intro: Dissochaeta borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Dissochaeta borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in tropical regions.
